title: MAFS Gabrielle Bartlett reveals plans to become a marriage celebrant
text:
She failed to find love with Nasser Sultan after their marriage on Married At First Sight back in 2018.

And it seems Gabrielle Bartlett, 45, is ready for another wedding - this time as a celebrant.

The reality TV star took to Instagram to announce the exciting news to her legions of followers on Saturday.

'Officially in training!' Married At First Sight's Gabrielle Bartlett (pictured) announced she will become a marriage celebrant to her legions of Instagram followers on Saturday

She wrote in the caption: 'Officially training with hopes of becoming a marriage celebrant!'

'I might be the world’s first MAFS bride in training to become a civil marriage celebrant,' she said.

'So I look forward to keeping you posted on this special, very heartfelt venture!'

Ready to wed: Gabrielle wrote in the caption, 'I might be the world’s first MAFS bride in training to become a civil marriage celebrant'

This comes after she was announced as a guest presenter for Seven's new shopping channel, Openshop back in August.

Gabrielle will appear on the program in an upcoming episode.

The channel focusses on beauty, jewellery, fashion, technology, home and health, and is viewed across Australia's five state capital cities and regional Queensland.

Failed romance: Despite failing to find love with Nasser Sultan (right) on Married At First Sight back in 2018, Gabrielle seems ready for another wedding - but this time as the celebrant

Managing director Jason Kim said in an official statement that the channel has been designed to make shopping from home 'even easier and more enjoyable'.

Openshop began broadcasting on August 1 and is available on Channel 75 through the Seven network.

Meanwhile, Gabrielle's ex Nasser, who was recently given his Instagram blue tick, also revealed he would be making a TV comeback on Channel Seven's First Dates.
description: She failed to find love with Nasser Sultan after their marriage on Married At First Sight back in 2018.
authors: Alisha Buaya For Daily Mail Australia
